release.action: Updated docs to remove reference of sourceforge as project is now hosted in github.
New Hoiio SPI implementation.
HTTP Multi Part request converter now enables to add additional parameters to the request via configuration.
Added CLIRR report as part of the maven build for the public client classes (not for internal SPI classes).
New Phaxio SPI implementation.
New HTTP XML response handler.
HTTP JSON response handler is now the default HTTP response handler.
Fixed windows test case when using JNI.

New HTTP Multi Part request converter class used to build multipart HTTP requests for the HTTP fax client SPI.
This converter is now the default converter instead of the template based converter.
HTTP JSON response handler also supports error response detection and handling.
Added support for different HTTP methods (POST, GET, PUT) for the HTTP SPI.
Initial support for HTTP JSON response handling.
Redesign of the HTTP SPI to enable more flexiable implementations (including in the future for REST).
Removed old HTTPTemplateFaxClientSpi SPI as the new implementation supports templates via converter.
Modified fax bridge and flow helper to support the x2fax sub project.
VBS SPI refactoring.
Documentation changes.
Documentation changes.
Decoupled the connection factory from the owner fax client SPI.
Fixed default email parser encoding handling.
VendorPolicy will now automatically listen for fax monitoring events if it implements the fax monitor event listener.
Documentation fixes.

Documentation fixes.
Internal refactoring for common configuration handling.
New nextivafax SPI implementation.
Full C++ build implemented as part of maven build (previously only the fax4j.dll was compiled).
Ensure native build is fired only once during the full maven build.
Converted many constant inner classes to enums.
Minor build changes.
Internal refactoring of the windows SPI.
Continued development of JUnit test cases for the fax4j library.
Internal fax bridge implementation changes.
The email2fax bridge now returns the submitted fax job.
Changed groupId to net.sf.fax4j

Major internal refactoring and code changes to support both frameworks (Fax Client SPI and X2Fax Bridge).
Moved few util classes to common package.
Documentation changes.
Documentation changes.
Windows SPI now extracts the fax4j.exe and fax4j.dll from inside the jar (no need to put them in the native path of the system and they are no longer packaged separately as part of the fax4j zip).
Fixed build shell script for non windows platforms.
pom.xml changes to support uploading fax4j to maven central.
Minor build change: fax4j.jar name now contains the fax4j version.
Minor build change: fax4j javadoc jar is created as part of the maven build.
pom.xml changes to support uploading fax4j to maven central.
New fax bridge framework to enable to provide x2fax capabilities (such as email2fax and others).

The fax4j library only throws FaxExceptions.
Other runtime exceptions were replaced.
Major internal refactoring and code changes to support both frameworks (Fax Client SPI and X2Fax Bridge).
Fixed HTTP SPI (set the setContentChunked as false).
Minor build changes and code cleanups.
Fixed HTTP SPI to enable suspend/resume/cancel fax job actions without the fax job object holding a reference to the fax job file.
Minor build changes and code cleanups.
fax4j.dll compilation and JNI header files generation are done as part of the maven build.
Moved fax4j.exe C++ code to fax4j.dll C++ code except the main method entry point (thin exe).
Fax events and listeners renamed to FaxClientActionEvent and FaxClientActionEventListener.

New fax monitor events and listeners to enable caller applications to monitor status changes of the submitted fax jobs.
This new monitoring events are currently only supported by the Windows and VBS SPIs.

Fixed process execution (used by several SPIs) due to java "bug fix" which broke the Runtime.exec(command) function.
More info can be found at:
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/6u45-relnotes-1932876.html
VBS SPI refactoring.
New common connection/factory infrastructure to be used by the internal SPIs as common solution to access third party resources.
HylaFax SPI refactoring (connection setup/release moved to new connection factory solution instead from inside the SPI).
Mail and COMM SPI connection refactoring (use new connection factory solution).
Added maven taglist report.
Documentation changes.
Internal refactoring and cleanups to make code more modular and testable.
New fax job property to set fax job file encoding (if not set, system encoding is used).
New HTTP SPI property to set template encoding (if not set, system encoding is used).
Fixed RFax SPI.
New abstract classes for the fax modem adapter.
Continued development of JUnit test cases for the fax4j library with over 150 test cases currently available.
Maven build now runs CheckStyle and generates reports.
Change log modified to new format based on maven standards.
Cross library quality code changes.
Removed unneeded jars from distribution.
Removed unneeded reports from site.
Maven build now runs PMD and FindBugs and generates reports.
Added JUnit and EMMA report.
fax4j build system moved to maven (as a result several structure changes were done).
License changes from LGPL to Apache 2.0 to help closed source project to adopt the library.
Initial development of JUnit test cases for the fax4j library.
Direct support for http proxy in the http SPI was removed.
COMM port SPI now uses RXTX library instead of javax.comm library (due to sun/oracle lack of support).
Support for COMM port handling via javax.comm API.

Enable to define a process output handler for the Process and Linux SPIs.

Minor C++ compilation changes.

Redesign of HTTP SPI to enable better flexibility.

Added support for fax event listeners to be registered.
Fixed the VBS SPI documentation.
The Windows SPI now fully supports all FaxClientSpi operations.
All SPIs now validate that the provided fax file is not empty.
The VBS SPI formats all fax job data to ensure VBS script does not break due to invalid script structure.
The VBS SPI error message is updated in case the fax server active X is not installed to better explain the problem.
Win2000 VBS will check if input is provided before setting the relevant fax field.
The VBS SPI now fully supports all FaxClientSpi operations when using the windows 2000 VBS API.
If the org.fax4j.spi.vbs.always.use.win2000.api property is not set the VBS SPI will default the value to true.
fax4j.properties updated. Property org.fax4j.spi.vbs.always.use.win2000.api is now set to true.
FaxClientSpiProxy can be enabled/disabled based on new fax4j configuration: org.fax4j.proxy.enabled (enabled by default)
Adapter fax client SPI can override fax4j configuration for internal SPI, see javadoc for more info.
postMethodInvocation method in FaxClientSpiInterceptor now also receives the method output.
New Provider interface.
Updated FaxClient and FaxClientSpi to enable access to the SPI provider.
New FaxClientSpiProxy interface used to proxy all fax client SPI method invocations to interceptors.

New FaxClientSpiInterceptor interface used to define fax client SPI method invocation interceptors. These interceptors enable to invoke custom logic before and after the fax client SPI method invocations (such as logging).
VBS script exceptions will contain the script output.
VBS SPI will validate script execution output for errors.
Adapter SPI now supports 'stable' condition (automatically validated for all SPIs), see javadoc for more info.
Every SPI has a new predefined property to support the new 'stable' condition.
